heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 3 cold snaps; typically, 3.6 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 0 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (213°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, fog or low cloud is expected, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
